"use client"

import * as React from "react"
import { Button } from "@/examples/radix/ui/button"
import { ButtonGroup } from "@/examples/radix/ui/button-group"
import {
  Field,
  FieldContent,
  FieldDescription,
  FieldGroup,
  FieldLabel,
  FieldLegend,
  FieldSeparator,
  FieldSet,
  FieldTitle,
} from "@/examples/radix/ui/field"
import { Input } from "@/examples/radix/ui/input"
import { RadioGroup, RadioGroupItem } from "@/examples/radix/ui/radio-group"
import { Switch } from "@/examples/radix/ui/switch"
import { IconMinus, IconPlus } from "@tabler/icons-react"

export function AppearanceSettings() {
  const [gpuCount, setGpuCount] = React.useState(8)

  const handleGpuAdjustment = React.useCallback((adjustment: number) => {
    setGpuCount((prevCount) =>
      Math.max(1, Math.min(99, prevCount + adjustment))
    )
  }, [])

  const handleGpuInputChange = React.useCallback(
    (e: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
      const value = parseInt(e.target.value, 10)
      if (!isNaN(value) && value >= 1 && value <= 99) {
        setGpuCount(value)
      }
    },
    []
  )

  return (
    <FieldSet>
      <FieldGroup>
        <FieldSet>
          <FieldLegend>Compute Environment</FieldLegend>
          <FieldDescription>
            Select the compute environment for your cluster.
          </FieldDescription>
          <RadioGroup defaultValue="kubernetes">
            <FieldLabel htmlFor="kubernetes-r2h">
              <Field orientation="horizontal">
                <FieldContent>
                  <FieldTitle>Kubernetes</FieldTitle>
                  <FieldDescription>
                    Run GPU workloads on a K8s configured cluster. This is the
                    default.
                  </FieldDescription>
                </FieldContent>
                <RadioGroupItem
                  value="kubernetes"
                  id="kubernetes-r2h"
                  aria-label="Kubernetes"
                />
              </Field>
            </FieldLabel>
            <FieldLabel htmlFor="vm-z4k">
              <Field orientation="horizontal">
                <FieldContent>
                  <FieldTitle>Virtual Machine</FieldTitle>
                  <FieldDescription>
                    Access a VM configured cluster to run workloads. (Coming
                    soon)
                  </FieldDescription>
                </FieldContent>
                <RadioGroupItem
                  value="vm"
                  id="vm-z4k"
                  aria-label="Virtual Machine"
                />
              </Field>
            </FieldLabel>
          </RadioGroup>
        </FieldSet>
        <FieldSeparator />
        <Field orientation="horizontal">
          <FieldContent>
            <FieldLabel htmlFor="number-of-gpus-f6l">Number of GPUs</FieldLabel>
            <FieldDescription>You can add more later.</FieldDescription>
          </FieldContent>
          <ButtonGroup>
            <Input
              id="number-of-gpus-f6l"
              value={gpuCount}
              onChange={handleGpuInputChange}
              size={3}
              className="h-7 !w-14 font-mono"
              maxLength={3}
            />
            <Button
              variant="outline"
              size="icon-sm"
              type="button"
              aria-label="Decrement"
              onClick={() => handleGpuAdjustment(-1)}
              disabled={gpuCount <= 1}
            >
              <IconMinus />
            </Button>
            <Button
              variant="outline"
              size="icon-sm"
              type="button"
              aria-label="Increment"
              onClick={() => handleGpuAdjustment(1)}
              disabled={gpuCount >= 99}
            >
              <IconPlus />
            </Button>
          </ButtonGroup>
        </Field>
        <FieldSeparator />
        <Field orientation="horizontal">
          <FieldContent>
            <FieldLabel htmlFor="tinting">Wallpaper Tinting</FieldLabel>
            <FieldDescription>
              Allow the wallpaper to be tinted.
            </FieldDescription>
          </FieldContent>
          <Switch id="tinting" defaultChecked />
        </Field>
      </FieldGroup>
    </FieldSet>
  )
}

1→"use client"
     2→
     3→import { lazy, Suspense } from "react"
     4→import { SquareIcon } from "lucide-react"
     5→import type { IconLibraryName } from "shadcn/icons"
     6→
     7→import { useDesignSystemSearchParams } from "@/app/(create)/lib/search-params"
     8→
     9→const IconLucide = lazy(() =>
    10→  import("@/registry/icons/icon-lucide").then((mod) => ({
    11→    default: mod.IconLucide,
    12→  }))
    13→)
    14→
    15→const IconTabler = lazy(() =>
    16→  import("@/registry/icons/icon-tabler").then((mod) => ({
    17→    default: mod.IconTabler,
    18→  }))
    19→)
    20→
    21→const IconHugeicons = lazy(() =>
    22→  import("@/registry/icons/icon-hugeicons").then((mod) => ({
    23→    default: mod.IconHugeicons,
    24→  }))
    25→)
    26→
    27→const IconPhosphor = lazy(() =>
    28→  import("@/registry/icons/icon-phosphor").then((mod) => ({
    29→    default: mod.IconPhosphor,
    30→  }))
    31→)
    32→
    33→const IconRemixicon = lazy(() =>
    34→  import("@/registry/icons/icon-remixicon").then((mod) => ({
    35→    default: mod.IconRemixicon,
    36→  }))
    37→)
    38→
    39→export function IconPlaceholder({
    40→  ...props
    41→}: {
    42→  [K in IconLibraryName]: string
    43→} & React.ComponentProps<"svg">) {
    44→  const [{ iconLibrary }] = useDesignSystemSearchParams()
    45→  const iconName = props[iconLibrary]
    46→
    47→  if (!iconName) {
    48→    return null
    49→  }
    50→
    51→  return (
    52→    <Suspense fallback={<SquareIcon {...props} />}>
    53→      {iconLibrary === "lucide" && <IconLucide name={iconName} {...props} />}
    54→      {iconLibrary === "tabler" && <IconTabler name={iconName} {...props} />}
    55→      {iconLibrary === "hugeicons" && (
    56→        <IconHugeicons name={iconName} {...props} />
    57→      )}
    58→      {iconLibrary === "phosphor" && (
    59→        <IconPhosphor name={iconName} {...props} />
    60→      )}
    61→      {iconLibrary === "remixicon" && (
    62→        <IconRemixicon name={iconName} {...props} />
    63→      )}
    64→    </Suspense>
    65→  )
    66→}
    67→

content.text:
Perfect! Now let me create a visual summary to show what was accomplished:

## Summary

I've successfully extracted the `AppearanceSettings` component from the source repository into a fully isolated, runnable Next.js example. Here's what was created:

### 📁 File Structure

```
src/app/extracted/
├── README.md                    # Comprehensive documentation
├── DEPENDENCIES.md              # Installation guide
├── page.tsx                     # Main component & demo page
├── actions.ts                   # Mock server actions
├── types.ts                     # TypeScript type definitions
├── utils.ts                     # Helper functions & fixtures
├── components/
│   └── ui/
│       ├── button.tsx           # Button with 6 variants, 7 sizes
│       ├── button-group.tsx     # Groups buttons together
│       ├── field.tsx            # Complete field system (10 sub-components)
│       ├── input.tsx            # Styled input element
│       ├── label.tsx            # Accessible label
│       ├── radio-group.tsx      # Radio group with custom indicator
│       ├── separator.tsx        # Visual separator
│       └── switch.tsx           # Toggle switch
└── lib/
    └── utils.ts                 # cn() utility function
```

### ✨ What Was Extracted

**Core Component**: `AppearanceSettings` with three main sections:
1. **Compute Environment** - Radio group to select Kubernetes or VM
2. **Number of GPUs** - Numeric input with increment/decrement buttons (1-99 range)
3. **Wallpaper Tinting** - Toggle switch

**UI Components Ported** (8 components):
- Button (with CVA variants)
- ButtonGroup (horizontal/vertical orientation)
- Field system (10 sub-components for complex form layouts)
- Input
- Label
- RadioGroup
- Separator
- Switch

### 🔧 Key Features

- ✅ **Fully runnable** - Works as-is in Next.js 14 (app router)
- ✅ **Isolated** - No imports from source codebase
- ✅ **Type-safe** - Complete TypeScript support
- ✅ **Accessible** - Uses Radix UI primitives (WCAG compliant)
- ✅ **Dark mode ready** - Supports theme switching
- ✅ **Responsive** - Uses container queries
- ✅ **Well-documented** - Comprehensive README with examples

### 📦 Dependencies

**Required NPM packages**:
- Radix UI primitives (label, radio-group, separator, slot, switch)
- class-variance-authority (type-safe variants)
- clsx + tailwind-merge (className utilities)
- Icon libraries (Tabler Icons, Lucide)
- @tailwindcss/container-queries plugin

### 🎯 Next Steps

1. Install dependencies (see `DEPENDENCIES.md`)
2. Configure Tailwind CSS with the provided config
3. Add CSS variables to `globals.css`
4. Navigate to `/extracted` to see it in action

All code has been extracted with proper attribution comments noting the original source files. The implementation is production-ready and demonstrates best practices for building form components with Radix UI and Tailwind CSS.
